body.p:
New Orleans, June 4, 1862.
To the Governor of the State of Kentucky:
Sir:

I seize the earliest moment afforded me by the reestablishment of mail communication between this City and the West, to solicit from you a renewal of my commission as a Commissioner of the State of Kentucky for the State of Louisiana.
My last commission expired on the 10th March last.

I may remark in closing that during the reign of terror which prevailed here for the ten or twelve months prior to the capture of the City, I have never wavered
in my Loyalty to the Union.

I am, sir, very Respectfully
Your Ob't serv't
Jas Graham

Louisiana
Comr. of Deeds
Jas. Graham
"City"
Com Issd Aug 1. 1862
